review: Their burgers are always cooked just the way that I ask for them to be. My favorite is the banzai burger. You wouldn't think a burger would pair well with teriyaki sauce, but it is delicious!  Their salads were amazing, and then they changed them (for some ridiculous reason), and now they are beginning to change them back. The Caesar salad has also made a return. Again, I'm not sure whose idea it was to change the salads, and get rid of one of their best ones, but it looks like they have fixed their mistakes.  Other items that are delicious and worth a try are their steak fries. They are 'bottomless', meaning they will continue to bring you out as many as you want. I think all of their sides may be bottomless, as well as the drinks! Our server was even kind enough to switch out what my friend wanted (she went back and forth between the light raspberry lemonade and diet coke). I think his name was either David, or Andrew. I wish I could remember because he was so friendly and quick to serve our table even though he had several other customers that day.  It had been a while since I had visited Red Robin (due to a gross salad and 'nearly' under-cooked chicken experience I had a few months back), but a friend of mine from Canada was in town and wanted to go. After our experience on Friday, I will definitely be back!

I have yet to have a bad experience here. Whether it is just my husband and I or the whole family we have a great time. They have a great selection of beers and a full bar. I usually get an IPA or a house margarita. My husband loves the burgers. And usually rotates through the different ones. I am a lover of fish and chips or salmon. They have an amazing cod sandwich. My youngest can have her moments of pickiness but they offer grilled cheese and I know that she will eat that. The sides are really kid friendly... she usually gets apple slices or french fries. We will be back for lunch or dinner again soon!

Dinner was great---the child that wanted this as her first post-braces meal was very happy.  I had the Smoke and Pepper burger and I was very happy.  Braces girl had the Double Tavern---She asked me to write she was in Heaven. She also said the fries are the best. Her brother had the Fiery Ghost Tavern Double. Or as I call it, the Death Burger.  He loved his insane food choice and the six glasses of water he needed just to get out of the restaurant. JK.  Seriously though, he did like the burger.  Wife had the Crispy Arctic Cod.  It's her staple here, she loves it and orders it every time (boring).  But it does say something for the sandwich.

You know, for a chain burger joint, this place always delivers. They have a menu that has your favorite burgers, then they introduce every once and awhile a new burger. They have super thick milkshakes, and yummy bottomless steak fries. I changed things up and got a pink class from the bar.  Try this place out, it is good food.

July 15, 2017 Saturday - 12:45 PM for lunch 4 Adults Atmosphere - 4 stars Food - 4 stars Service - 4 stars Background - Time to get lunch before our shopping for the day. Atmosphere - Place screams chain, huge dining area divided into sections.  We were in the back cover.  Lots of televisions with baseball games on. Food   Drinks - Fresh Squeezed IPA by Deschutes.   Lunch - Siracha Tavern Double, their tavern burgers are smaller than their normal ones so it was a perfect for lunch.  I had to take four bites before I even had a hint of siracha.  A name like siracha I would expect some heat.  None was even present in the burger so that was disappointing.  The burger was still tasty and worth the money.  The sweet potato fries were good. Service - I expect when you change from regular fries to sweet potato and there is an extra fee the server would tell you there is an increase when they tell you about them. Future - Sure.

I really dislike having to write a negative review.  This Red Robin is normally warm, friendly and inviting.  On this occasion it was none of those things. We arrived around 3:30 p.m. There were two other tables besides ours. We asked for a few minuets. Our waitress went to the back of the restaurant and was sitting with two workers who were eating and talking. I tried to get her attention. Once I got her attention she went to the other two tables before coming to ours. She seemed annoyed. We placed our order.  Our waitress dropped off our order. My hamburger smelled off and smelled bad. I managed to get my waitresses attention and she told me "What your smelling is the Broiler". No that is not what I am smelling. It was a burger I have gotten before. The meat smelled bad.  I asked her to send it back. She was annoyed but did so. When she brought it to the kitchen I could hear laughter and some of the workers were making fun of me. I then asked to speak to the manager. He was annoyed and proceeded to tell me that he knew bad meat as that was his business. He then added that he had personally made my burger. I don't know what that was suppose to mean. I told him that it was bad business to laugh and speak negatively about a customer where they could hear you. He said he would have a talk with them.  I got a new burger and it was fine. I ate the whole thing. But the manager and our waitress make me not want to go back for a really long time. I have never had this kind of treatment here before. Normally this is one of my favorite places to go.

This particular location has some things to work on.  Food quality and taste was so so.  Nothing special or memorable.  I ordered the teriyaki chicken sandwich with garlic fries.  The burger  was not bad and the garlic fries were sad.  They were just steak fries with all the garlic and cheese stuck to the bottom of the plate.  The server had some severe memory problems also. He couldn't remember anything with our orders or condiments.  Overall about a C- establishment.

Excellent gourmet burgers. Extensive menu for all things burger-related. If you're not hungry for burgers then you can order sandwiches, soups, salads, chicken, fish, etc. The alcohol menu complements the food quite nicely. To top it all off, you can order food for pickup online. In all, one of the top burger restaurants in the Reno area.

Every time my son and I come here for a nosh I always feel like a VIP.  I usually order the Bar Wings and Chips with the BBQ sauce. I know their burgers are also de-lish, but I prefer the wings. Occasionally order salad and soup. The chicken tortilla is the best.  Don't forget their entree menu. Salmon is usually a good choice.  If fish isn't your thing, go for skillet menu.  Service is always fab-lous and greeted with smiles. We are a reward customer. Its a quick easy sign up. Download the app to keep track of the rewards. You will give them your phone number before they bring the check so your rewards are signed in.  This location also offers orders to go. I think you call in the order.then a server will bring it out to your car.   Also if your just wanting a quick bite to eat, go with any of the yummy appetizers. chips and salsa is always a favorite. If you prefer a app with a twist, try the fried pickles.  You'll totally enjoy. Bottomless fries, some beverages, and kids menu is a great family and large group hang out.  Kids get balloons if you ask for it.  If your having a birthday, they will sing a happy song with dancing and clapping. Its a fun place for all ages.  If you have allergies, be sure to tell your server. They will provide a menu just for your allergen preferences.  They have a full bar with tv (usually sports baseball, football, soccer). Never a dull moment. Deserts are always a favorite.  Try the Fruffles with a berry dipping sauce.  Friday and Saturdays are the busiest with waitlist.  Parking lot can be sometimes crowded. Best to get there early.  Friday and Saturday open till 10pm. Other nights open till 9pm.
Our favorite burger place. A little overpriced but i guess you get what you pay for. We will be back

Husband and I really like this location. It's always clean and the staff is super friendly. We ordered the onion rings with extra campfire sauce to share. I normally get the whisky river BBQ burger, but tonight I saw they had a 4 cheese melt sandwich and had to try it. With bacon of course! Definitely a good choice with bottomless steak fries. Hubby got the big ghost burger and demolished super fast! I didn't get our servers name, but she was delightful and made sure we were always taken care of.

Went here for lunch. Extensive menu with many options on burgers. Unlimited beefsteak fries that came with the meal. I have been to another Red Robin where you got the fries immediately upon being seated. We ordered the onion ring stack with 2 sauces that were amazing. I would highly recommend the onion rings. A table next to us got the spinach dip and that looked really good as well.  Service was a little slow but we did arrive right at lunch and it was pretty busy. You can check out right at the table when you're done, which would have been nice to know as we waited awhile for our server for the bill. Next time we will be prepared. Food was good and nice choice. Would go back.

This place can be hit or miss, lately it's been a lot more miss. Friday we went for dinner, I had the fish and chips she had a cheeseburger. Mine was fine although the endless fries kinda ended without more.  Her cheeseburger came with all the stuff she asked for them not to have on it. The waitresses attitude was basically she could care less as was the "supervisor"  Might as well go to IHOP

This is my favorite location out of all the local red robin establishments.  This particular one is always very clean,  the staff is very friendly and it's never too busy.  The wait times are always manageable.  They offer fun games at the table via a tablet and also gives you the ability to pay your bill right there instead of waiting for the staff.

The quality of the burgers seems to be lacking.  They have a large selection, but seems to be doing well with the chicken and salmon better.  It's is your typical chain restaurant that just seems to no really putting a lot in all they have to offer.   Also, Watch your receipt.  They will charge you for items that you don't receive.  Buyer beware.

ok so I do have to revamp my review.  We have been here MANY times since this event and they have REALLY improved their food and service.  We are actual "regulars" now.  It is my son's favorite place to eat.  The service has improved 150% since that incident.  Way to go Red Robin!!  Keep up the great work. :)

The burgers, fries, onion rings are really good and many of the waiters here are great. Fast service, make you feel like they are your friends, and they never skimp you on to go orders but usually throw in extra fries, so I throw in a bigger tip . I don't suggest their chicken sandwiches or salads as the chicken seems like prepackaged, microwaved..just odd texture even. The shakes are excellent. Stick with the foods that made them famous and you will be very happy.

It's your typical chain restaurant. I will say that their servers are very friendly and courteous. We've gone to this location twice and have only had two issues (which aren't really "issues"). The first would be that we felt the waiter was overly pushy about getting us to order dessert and the other was that we waited about 3-5 minutes for someone to come and see us/seat us. We did try to get someone's attention but I guess they were really busy. Nonetheless, overall review: good food and good service.

Went to the sparks red robin tonight for the free travern double burger. Arrived early, just the 2 of us, had wanted to eat up front in the bar, but all the booths were taken, so we sat in a booth in the rear of the resturant. Bad choice, there was a table near us with 5 unruly children and only one adult with them, they were loud, screaming, and all over the place. Maybe awhile before we return to the Red Robin. Our tavern burgers were OK. The beer prices were high, with no prices on the menu.
Awesome service! They gave me my fries up front and kept refilling my drink! The quickest most friendly service I've had in years! David is the best server!
Good. Been to other Red Robin's and this one by far has the best service and friendliest staff.

I know your probably wondering why I am giving a five star review on a place I have not checked in to. Well long story short my data on my phone ran out so I couldn't use it. However, I want to write a review.  I have not had service or experience like this in a long time. I have to give a huge thank you to Makenzie our waitress. Yes, your waitress or waiter makes a huge difference in your experience.  So it started out at nobody wanted to cook and we just happen to drive by and say lets eat there. We walked in and were seats very fast. Our waitress came over and offered us drinks right away and explain the machine on the table. The best part is how honest she was. She said if we want to order sooner we can use the machine because sometimes she can't get to us as fast! But it is understandable. Tons of clients and orders I get it. She seemed like she was happy to be there and was in a great mood and was nice!  Well, she was on top of it! Are drinks were constantly being refilled. I don't think I had my cup go half way down. Well then we ordered. I got a Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger with garlic fries. Well done, oh yeah and bottomless fries. When eating this burger, I was able to taste all of the flavors. I actually did not have a plain meal like I'm use to at other places. Maybe is was my lucky night!!! So the food was good, the service was good,now the environment. Is was clean and entertaining for my kiddo. The best part is then achieves they have in the table for putting in orders and oh yeah paying right there so you don't have to wait for a check(which I'll get to in s minute) they also have games for kids to play if they get restless. They do however charge you I believe $1.99. But handy for restless ones when trying to visit with friends and family! Ok so paying, on the screen it have all these options like a smartphone of what you want! Well when pushing paycheck it brings up your order. So we did and we were checking it out because it was our first time using something like this. Like o said our waitress was on top of customer service she ending up over by us asking if we get it and showed us how to use it! Seemed pretty simple! And the new was of paying for meals!  As for going back, yes definitely! Just so I can get that kind of service again and the enjoyment of the meal!

Absolutely filthy the table and booths are sticky some type of disgusting film on the inside windows and ziosk machine I don't think they own a vacuum there's more food on the floor than on are table I would hate to see what the managers house looks like I'm leaving after finding something floating in my beer

Dirty tables, dirty chairs, dirty glasses and  plates, dirty silverware...Frozen chicken in burgers that was not even warmed up, terrible food, absolutely no service...This place should not be open...Antisanitary all around. NEVER AGAIN... DO NOT GO UNLESS YOU ENJOY TERRIBLE SERVICE FOOD AND PLACE
Food is always good. Service has been hit or miss. The past couple of times it certainly has gotten better. I think some of the wait staff could work on their professional presence.
The service was good. Our food came out really quickly and was delicious! I think the prices were fair because it was really good. I think that I have underestimated Red Robin!

The service was ok the waitress was cool! We were reading our menus and then right then and there, with the waitress standing there taking our order an !earwig!climbs out of the menu earwig the red little pincher bugs ! !!  ! She rushed to get rid of it ! Kinda wild we got our food and it was fine still just a little creeped out ! The manger did come over to see if things were ok ! I mean yea, there aren't any bugs in the food so yea I guess it's ok? Well that's true story and I am sticking to it ! Could just be a little mistake could be something else that is y I am saying something now !

I took me and my children to the Sparks Nevada location and we were seated quickly. However, we sat there for 10 minutes without anyone acknowledging us and straight across from us were 4 servers on break stuffing their faces and then the hostess who sat us came and joined them while shoving French fries in her face and stared right at us still sitting there with no waitress. I watched 3 groups of people come in after us and they were all helped. I was so irritated I got up and left. This was on 3-11 at approx 3:00pm. I will never go there again!

Had to have our order taken twice (just my wife and I).  The server never stopped by to see how we were doing, we had to stop the poor gal seating people if we could get refills.  Then when the drinks came by, the server (not ours) was too occupied to get back behind the counter so she could hug a couple people either coming or going.  No one, not one person, not even the Supervisors ever came by to ask if we wanted desert. We never got a bill, which we could have probably just walked out? But I paid by the table computer. Left a complaint and still today never heard from anyone!  So now everyone will hear.   And when we first arrived there was no wait, one couple in the bar area, and three tables in the restaurant area??
Found a hair in my burger, said they could make me another burger but can't refund me.   I'm never coming back
We just had dinner here and had a great time. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the food was hot and fresh. It's a great place to go for a casual meal with your family and friends.

I hate writing poor reviews. I do. I feel like I'm Charlie Brown's mom on the phone, wah wah wah-wah wah. But, here I am, nagging away.  I'm giving red robins a two star rating only because the service team was great starting from the hostess, to the server, to the manager.  I did see food dying under the heat lamp for a while, while waiting for a table in the waiting area.  It SEEMED pretty busy, but I felt like there was an adequate amount of staff members.  Anyway... My BIGGEST complaint was the food! I ordered an appetizer: the spinach artichoke dip. The dip was cold in some spots then barely warm in others. The chips were GREASY.  My boys ordered pizza and mini corn dogs. My oldest normally loves corn dogs, but he just picked out the hot dogs and left the outer part on his plate.  I ordered what I thought was one of their "tavern" burgers. I was expecting to be wowed with all of the bacon talk, but was let down. I'd have to say Ive probably had a better burger at McDonald's. It tasted burnt and man oh man was everything greasy. There was actually a pool of grease under my burger. Normally I love garlic fries and loved the concept of bottomless fries, but I didn't even finish my initial order.  I'd have to say, that I most likely would not return. Now I'm just sitting here disappointed with an upset stomach. Brayden says his hurts too...

I tried this again and still very poor service I really like the food and the atmosphere but just can't get good service or any service at that. They say bottomless fries but they never bring them too you, would defiantly not recommend this place to anyone...

For the food - overall if was very good.  We started off with the tower of onion rings, nice and crispy.  Hubby had the ghost pepper burger and really liked it.  He loves hot things and said this had a real good kick.  I had the Avo-cobb-o chicken salad and it was also very tasty.  Avocados were too mushy but it still was a very good salad. For the service - it was rotten.  When the tower of onion rings came, it is customary to also bring small plates so everyone can put their serving on it, right?  No plates, had to flag someone down to get them.  Then, no silverware or napkins on the table, waitress nowhere in sight, so I went and found some myself.  We had to flag someone else down for drink refills.  I had to go find the sugar (for the coffee) myself as well.  Finally at the end of the meal we needed a to-go box and of course, our waitress was nowhere, so I went and found the box myself.  Heck, I should have tipped myself too because I was doing all the work.   It's clear that the staff needs to be properly trained, so management needs to step up and see to it that waitresses actually know what they are doing.

I came in with my 8 year old grandson for dinner, and to use my birthday comp to celebrate my 60th birthday.  Food and service were wonderful.  Looking forward to my special dessert and celebratory rendition of Happy Birthday, but it never happened.  Turning 60 is a big deal for most guys, and it was to me.  I used their contact section to sooth my hurt feelings, and left it there.  A few days later, I get a voicemail from who I assume was a manager, saying the usual "Were sorry Red Robin yada yada yada"  I was kind of expecting a comped meal, but she tells me "if you are in the area, stop by and we'll sing you Happy Birthday" What kind of condescending  crap was that?  Like I'm going to "stop by" so I can collect my song?

Our server was awesome, however almost everything we ordered was messed up. We had to ask repeatedly for the salsa that came with the queso, waited forever for my drink, and were served the wrong fries with one of our entrees.

I have reason to believe this restaurant is poorly managed. I am a RR regular and have been for many years at half a dozen other locations. Since moving to Sparks. I have eaten in this particularly one multiple times. Consistently, I/we have experienced poor, slow service especially if we sit in the bar lounge area. Usually in the bar once we get our food we don't receive follow-up to see if we want drink refills or more of the "endless fries". Each time I have taken the customer service survey and given details regarding my issues with this place and nothing seems to have changed. Including dirty dusty window shelf with dead flies.  So, today we drove and tried out the Reno RR for the first time and the service was excellent and the restaurant and restroom was clean. UPDATE: today a national survey was published of the 20 worst casual dining restaurants in the USA and RED ROBIN made the list...

I took my family to have brunch here and as we ordered our appetizers everything was ok. However when we ordered our food, once we got it my dad's food was wrong and my sister's burger had a huge hair in it. I told the waiter and she seemed disturbed about it. I took them so long to get the order back out that by that time we just wanted to go!

Went in for my free bday burger. Not only did I get a burger but also onion rings, and ice cream. The waiter Mike did a great job unfortunately I couldn't take the survey because my total was $0. Figured at least I can say things on yelp. Was a very good visit and the burning love burger was really good. Very happy.

I don't really ever have a bad experience at this sparks location. Lindsey at the bar is super nice and very outgoing! I like their beer selections as they always change them due to the season and I normally get the BLTA or a burger. Random but it can be kind of cold if you sit at the bar, the air is always blowing.. So bring a jacket :)  Overall good experience!!

Our last experience at this Red Robin wasn't great but today was terrible. First, we received our soup and salad without silverware and it was easily 10 minutes before the waitress came back with them. Next when our food did arrive it was cold.  Not cool but flatly cold. We had the fish and chips.  The cod was mushy, the shrimp was doughy and undercooked. Our waitress was friendly enough but clearly harried and at her wits end with orders. Overally not a good experience.

When you have kids and want to have a meal that you can all enjoy this is a good spot. They have a full bar, a large menu and the service is great. Well, it's only my first time at this location but my server, Elizabeth, has been perfect. She offered us a loyalty card which I had no idea existed. You get free stuff for coming in and on your birthday. Fun! I do wish there were more veggie options but it is a burger place and you can throw that veggie patty on any of their creations.  I definitely feel like I get my money's worth here. I have a feeling I'll be here often.

I very rarely go out of my way to write a review if the review is not stellar.  But here we go.  Last night, fathers day dinner, I chose Red Robin because I do like their food.  I arrived about 7pm with my wife 15 mins behind me.  I was seated immediately.  I had no one greet me, ask about appetizers or drinks for a bit over 10 mins.  There were plenty of staff.  They just walked by me.  I got their wireless device and hit "call server" and in about 3 or 4 minutes one finally came by.  I get it, things happen, everyone is entitled to a prob or two.  I ordered boneless wings and ice tea for wife and I, who had just arrived.  Ice tea in about 10 minutes (no water or anything yet), and appetizer in another 10 or so.  Now, I do not have great expectations, but come on.  Anyhow, boneless wings were dropped by someone else, and I do mean dropped.  They were only half coated in BBQ and therefore dry.  If I wanted crappy chicken, KFC is right around the corner.  Anyhow...  I was starved, ate them anyway.  I tried multiple times to flag down server for refill of my tea, and finally wife yelled out :"HEY" to get anyone's attention.  Refill arrived after our meal by another 10 or so minutes.  Our waitress said she was frazzled.  Me too.  I had the sombrero smokey bbq salad.  One small thing of dressing, and the chicken was still pink (somewhat raw) on the inside.  We finished what we could and left.  Like I said, I rarely post bad stuff, but this was so bad, I didn't feel like filling out the survey on the spot.  F this. It killed my fathers day dinner.  I don't expect the world but one sign of good service is making sure that our drinks are filled; FAIL.  Appetizer good: NOPE, FAIL .  Meal good, not cooked thoroughly; FAIL.  I have many choices on where to go.  I sincerely doubt I will return to this establishment.  Expectations ; a "C" to "B", reality "F".

Maybe you have to be a kid to like the cooks decision to put out well done Hamburg when you order Med-rare hamburger;cold sweet potato fries; my husbands chile burger was cold and lousy...in the last year I've been comp't  so many meals because of horrible food.. We ordered 2 cheesecake to go, just to find out they tasted like refrigerator......it's over for me and my family, we will never eat at Red Robin again

We came here to try the 2 tavern, fries and dessert for $15 deal.  It was really busy in here when we got here. About 5 minutes after we were seared our server, Krysten, stopped by, apologized for  he wait and asked for our drink orders (lemon waters).  She helped my wife locate the tavern burger options in the menu and  its that took out order.  My wife ordered the pig-out burger and I ordered the ghost burger.  A few minutes came by when our server came by and apologized for not having the food in sooner and admitted that it was her fault. With net manager's approval she gave us a basket of fries to start snacking on.  My wife said that the pig out's sauce was a little in the sweet side.   The ghost burger brought some heat, which is what I had hoped for.   Both burgers are on the small side.   The freckled lemonade cake was very sweet.  Overall a good value.   We will come back just because of servers like Krysten owning up to her mistake and trying to make it right without us having to say anything.

Last night a friend had her birthday dinner at the local Red Robin. There were 14 of us which included 6 kids. We showed up after half the group was already there, had drinks, and the waiter came by quick to get drink orders. I ordered a draft beer, kids had sodas and wife went with a mixed   took about 15 mins to get our drinks, place wasnt that busy or id understand.they didnt have menues on the tables yet, so the server went and grabbed some. Whats this? They're in spanish? We asked the server for menues in english, crazy idea right? Here in America and all..... the server replied with, "we are all out of english menues but if you need help, i can translate"..... is that a joke? After our drinks showed up, the server started taking orders, i figured with the amount of time it took to get a draft beer, id order the chips and salsa with guac for an appetizer with the thought itd take forever to get our meals. Buzzzzzzzzz wrong. 45 mins later all the food came out, you guessed it, with the appetizer. So, to recap, on a 14 top with a moderate to slow night, a Saturday night, it took forever to get simple drinks, an appetizer before the entrees, and they had zero english menues....... 2 stars, the beer was cold and the food was good. No english menues!!!!! What the FUCK is going on with society that having zero english menues is acceptable? Its bad enough you have to press 2 for english, now this?!?!? I mentioned it to the girls at the front, with the manager standing behind them, and they laughed, fucking laughed. I will NEVER dine or order take out from a RED ROBIN again. Never. Guaranteed i will drag this chain through the mudd to anyone who will listen, and sadly, the chain, the manager, and the employees wont bat an eye. Why? Because for every person like me, there are thousands who dont care and to them, its not a big deal. Fair enough.

Pretty good food I have yet to have a bad experience there the staff is very friendly an now with the tablets at every table you never have to worry about not getting a drink or ordering appetizers you just do it from there an it goes straight to the kitchen or bar an is out in a very reasonable time.

Love this place, service was great and the burgers were excellent. I had the southern burger. The bacon is carmelized along with the onions in  brown sugar. The taste is incredible. The burger is served on a soft brioche bun.

Awful service !!!!! Asked for well done and got medium rare burgers...it wouldn't be a big deal except it was a to go order and by the time my husband got home and we realized the mistake .  they were about to close !!!!!  Husband spoked to  2 different managers ( Erin and Michael)  ...we were promised  a gift card was going to be mailed  to us and it has been a month and nothing!!!!  We know Red Robins doesn't care about their customers  or there dining experience at there  restarurants .....so, avoid this awful place ...do yourself a favor and take your money somewhere else .....

Where do I start with this location?  I'm visiting my parents from out of town and our Red Robin is good. I will start with it took our waiter, Mike, 10-15 min to come over to even greet us to get waters, by the time he did come over we had already made up our minds on what to order as well. We ordered our food and I got a spicy sombrero salad no tomatoes dressing on the side and a grilled chicken kids meal with a salad. We waited for our food for 25-30 min and I saw 2 other parties receive their orders before us and we ordered salads with chicken... Come on! I honestly blame the server he was horrible. Not personable, when we asked about our food he blamed the kitchen and chicken not being cooked all the way through. Just horrible service. Disappointed!

Good food most of the time, sometimes they over cook my burger which I ask for medium, knowing for sure they're bout to make it barely pink inside. Also me and my wife ordered spinach dip and had barely enough for maybe 3 chips a piece. I could've eaten all of it in two spoonfulls. Staff was nice, Dylan was great server, we'll be back just stay away from the dip

We love this place, and we try to make it a game of exploring the menu. So far favorites are the onion ring stacker, the royal burger, and the shroom burger. Don't forget the bottomless fries! I usually am so stuffed and can not eat more than one little cup of them. It's generally not too loud, but can be in the dinner rush. Thats when the waiters/waitress can get a bit frantic, but still do a pretty good job (although last time we were there, our waiter lost our loyalty card. Gave us a new one, but really should of gave us a perk for losing the card.)  Food is always good, staff is always great, and its a pretty clean place. Great for big groups and children:)
Obviously it's full of kids. Don't go there if you're not ok with this. There is a more adult section by the bar but it's still always crazy in there. Good burgers

We love this restaurant and come here at least a few times a week.  While the menu isn't the most health friendly ever, almost everything is customizable to make it a little more nutritious and less calorie-ridden.  They have THE best staff ever.  They are so friendly and always remember us.  My kids love the table top games and the food.  Love this place!

I HIGHLY recommend this particular Red Robin in Spanish Springs. Their food is amazing! But even more important to me is the fact that they are totally on top of gluten issues and take all of the steps to insure that I can safely eat there. Be sure to tell your server that you have a gluten allergy, if you do. If you are eating gluten free just for health reasons, you will enjoy the flavor of their buns and all, but you do not have to go through as many precautions and can let them know, too. But if you have an intolerance, Celiac, or something similar.... this is a great place to eat locally. If you don't know if something has gluten, there usually are a couple of people (including at least one manager) who are rather knowledgeable (at least when I have needed to ask a question). When your order is ready, a manager will bring out your meal and it will be in a yellow basket (instead of the red). If there is ANY question, they remake whatever it is. I have never questioned it there, but several times (I go there all the time) a manager has brought me part of my food and apologized for the delay on the other part (usually the fries), because they could not personally guarantee there was no cross-contamination (etc) of my particular item so they are having them remade to make sure. I am definitely OK with that. I would much rather start on part of my food and have the other come just a bit later and eat without getting sick. I have never gotten sick after eating at THIS particular Red Robin. Definitely the best one in the area!
Great service tonight. Can't remember the waitress name but she was great and kept our fries and drinks full

Tasty burgers, but the reason I come here is for the jalapeño coins. The problem is they are frequent out of them! The last time I came here I ordered to go, paid, and then about 10 minutes later was told they didn't have the jalapeño coins. They offered to refund the amount or exchange. I chose to exchange it, but honestly if I knew they didn't have the coins I would have gone somewhere else. The servers are always really nice though. Just be sure to have them double check that they have what you want before you commit!
Go see Mike. Tues wed Thursday. Best server ever. Could have served me anything and it would have been good. This guy is so upbeat and friendly. My kids 9 and 5 even commented how nice he was.

The food is consistent and fresh. The drinks are over priced but they may have a happy hour, not sure. The service we received on a Monday night was top notch, attentive and friendly male server. We had not visited this location for 3 or 4 years and will probably be back sooner this time. Only 3 stars because it's still a chain, nothing special about the menu.
Our server was Mike and he was very friendly and attentive. Offered good selections.  Party of four and everyone enjoyed their food. I was on the fence about going but was impressed.

I am so very disappointed in our Reno Red Robin. My wife and I had lunch there today and sadly the food was not very good. After telling the server about the problem, nothing happened no apologies no manager nothing. So I guess that we won't be returning because I won't eat drive thru food nor will pay the prices that Red Robin charges for their drive thru food.

Food is ok not great ! staff is very friendly atmosphere is fun and relaxing and the pear lemonade was pretty good along with the orange cream soda I got , and the price was not bad at al 3 meals for under 50$ with drinks

Fantastic service from our server Mike. I came in at a busy time and I could tell that they were understaffed. I watched this guy hustle around a bunch to meet everyone's needs. A fantastic employee deserves a shoutout.
They actually opened the door at 10:55 so I could get a gift certificate for my friends birthday , thought that was worth a attaboy!!!!

Gone downhill in the last month! We have been here 6 or 7 times.  My Wife and I dined Monday 7/26/15 at 6:15 pm and noticed the change for the worse at the front door.  We said "Thank You" three times to the young man who greeted us and showed us to our table and his response was the same all three times "No Problem". Huh? Our server was another guy and did not know what the special beers on tap were.  When I asked him if he had a list (like the servers all used to have) he said " No I don't have a list, they change the beers every week or so".  When I asked if he has any Hefeweizen beer he said he didn't know and would have to go and ask a bartender.  He then stood there staring at me until I asked him to go ask a bartender about Hefeweizen.  Several minutes later the server returned, said they didn't have any Hefeweizen and did not suggest any alternative.  The hamburgers we ordered were poorer quality beef than they used to be and did not taste very good for a $10 hamburger.  The steak fries served were about half the quantity compared to previously.  Good news : the server did ask if we wanted ranch dressing for our fries and brought us 2 servings. He also asked us if we wanted water and brought them promptly. The last time we ate here our server said the current franchiser was getting out of the business and Red Robin corporate was taking over the restaurant soon.  I don't know if this explains the poor service and poor quality of the hamburgers. Beware of this Red Robin location.

So upon my lack of service on 27 December review, had a service member contact me asking for my information to talk about my experience because they said "looks like we missed the mark here and want to fix your experience". Well I sent them my information twice. Got a response from the company stating, and this is the actual email words, "Thanks for your email, and I apologize for the delayed response. We've shared your comments with the Guest Relations Team, and you should be hearing from a Team Member in the next day or two." That was on 5 January.  So Between 27 December 2014 and 12 January 2015 I get 1 email stating I will be contacted by 8 January 2015. Well still nothing and I emailed them again stating I feel like I am being treated the same way at the restaurant on 27 December. Definitely not a good customer service company nor do they follow up like they say they will. Never again will I, nor should anyone else, have to put up with this. I hope everyone stops going there and run them out because I had a little issue that could have been resolved over the phone and they just look at me as nothing in their big company boots. CLOSE YOUR DOORS because you do not care about your customers.

We were seated quickly and the service was good. I ordered one of the specials. I cannot recall the name, but it was chicken with a Mexican style sauce and a side salad. I thought it was delish and would certainly order it again. My kids had a corn dog with apple slices and they seemed to enjoy their meal as well!

We were waiting for 15 minutes for a table, and then some teenagers come in and get a table in less then 5. Well we sit down and order food, and we order more fries and refills on our drinks. It's not even busy and they take more tgan 15 minutes to carry out our orders. Really bad service. Not ever coming here again.

Ordered food to go and took over 30 minutes and made me late back to work.  Beer selection wasn't great.  Saving grace was the really hot blue haired bartender girl.  I wouldn't mind climbing on top of her naked.
Had a bad meal somewhere else. Had to comfort my tummy, so came here.  We like it. Just had spinach artichoke dip, burger for the husband & corn dogs for the grandson.

Showing up at 4:30pm you'd think orders would be executed correctly. My son ordered a coke with no ice, which showed up with ice. He then ordered a grilled cheese with apples, which then showed up with fries. My red white and blue salad somehow lost the blue on the way to the table. Not impressed, cross them off the list. Bully's, I'm sorry I strayed.

The Good, The Bad and the Ugly UPDATE: There was a good ending to this. The Bad Major misfires at Red Robin of Sparks. First, Red Robin has changed the allergy menu to an online version. You need to have a web connected smart phone to access, then spend 10 minutes configuring your "custom" menu to order. Oh, not all items on the custom menu are available at all locations.  The Ugly Second, with only about 15 tables seated it took over an hour to get our food. We almost got our food, but disaster struck in the kitchen and they had to start our order again.  At least the manager brought us some fries to hold us over. Not the best night for Red Robin. The Good The manager became our server, and at the end of the meal he not only comped the entire meal, he also gave us a gift card for a future visit.  He took charge of a bad situation, and did everything in his power to make it right.  Because of his efforts, we will be returning to Red Robin.

I normally like red robin but i left with a bad taste in my mouth tonight.  My new  name for them is "Dead Robin" as the customer service was dead in mu opinion.  We went to our local red robin order drinks and an appetizer.  Appetizer came a bit cooler than normal bit it was ok since they were onion rings.  My drink was a gingerbread jack and ginger ale type of drink but my daughters didn't come.  About 5 minutes later sever came by and asked how things were And noticed we didn't get the other drink we ordered. About 10 minutes later her hard root beer and ice cream float arrived and my daughter poured it herself.  I was the only one to order an entrée which was a bonsai burger with fries.  I waited and waited and waited.  The server came by several times saying they were running behind in the kitchen but my food would be out soon.  A table of 6 or 7 came in to the booth next to us and ordered food and 10 minutes later they all got their food including the lady closest to me who ordered exactly what i ordered:  a bonsai burger and fries!  After 45 minutes of waiting i flagged the server again and said i  could not wait anymore.  I asked for the burger to be removed from the bill so i could simply pay for the rest.  She left a bit upset and shortly after someone came over (manager or another server?)  and asked how things were going.  I explained 45 minutes of waiting for a burger that never arrived only to see someone else served the sane meal i ordered long before they even arrived was unacceptable.  I again asked if they could simply remove the burger from bill so i  could pay it and leave.  She then told me that she was not going to charge me for anything and my food food would be ready in a few minutes.  She asked me to wait a fee more minutes for the food buy at that point i was so frustrated we just left.  I went to Sonic down the street and got a great burger in five minutes.  One of the reasons we used  to go to red robin was for the drinks which were not that great and slow this time.  Ironically we were here two weeks ago and had a different experience. I wish i could say it was an isolated experience but there were people behind us with a similar experience, a family in a booth who had to talk with the manager (i assume he had a striped shirt on.  I left with a bad taste in my mouth of bad service, and the food i came there for.  To be fair i probably could have stayed and got my burger bit i was afraid the cooks or server would sabotage my food for complaining.  Too bad as I will likely not return to this location anytime soon if ever.  I was generous and gave them one star since they comped the onion rings and two badly made drinks.   **Update** Went back to try them again and it was much better this time around.  Just for fun we ordered almost the same things again and it was better all around.  Server was friendly, food arrived quickly and was good.

I'm pretty satisfied every time I go. I only maybe had one slight issue there but all the good beats the 1 bad. Great customer service and good food. Love my royalty card, and you get what you pay for here.
Good burgers, and you can have any made with a veggie patty!  Love the endless fries. Waitress Tamera was amazing with our special needs son!

Well havnt been there in about 6 months and it use to be great and went yesterday and got a burger with a group of 11 people and my burger so so burnt worst burger I have ever had in my life if I wasnt with a group I would have said something only had two bites of it and the lady didn't even ask why I didn't eat it won't be ba back for awhile hope they have a new cook next time

Horrible service... 3/6/15 @ 1:30 PM, not busy really, empty tables everywhere. We ordered our food, waited about 10 minutes, then watched our food sit for 15 minutes while 20 other orders were delivered to other tables before complaining to the manager and then the waitress finally got our food (which was cold). When telling the waitress she told manager and they did nothing, just let let us walk out without attempting to apologize. Ridiculous

We visit this location every once in a while and it's always good. Our server tonight was Tony and he was great, so it's a good time to leave a review. I usually always get the whiskey river bbq sandwich and tonight's was great as usual. Piping hot chicken...I can tell it came off the grill and very quickly was served to me. Fast and friendly service and good quality all around.

This restaurant does not deserve even a review. I live just a few miles from this place and this is only the second time I have been in to order food. the last time, two years ago,  was a horrendous experience . this was my first and last return trip to this place. I ordered from the bar area a Bonzai with no cheese or pineapple and to add mushrooms , basically making it a Teriyaki Mushroom burger. it arrived in 20 minutes with the cheese and pineapple and was missing the mushrooms, bartender said she ordered it correctly and would get it changed. well 25 minutes later , no hamburger and I need to get on with my day after waiting almost 50 minutes and getting NO!!!!!! food. I dropped a 20 on the bar and left without my food or any service.  This restaurant is one of those that will not survive, it cannot continue to make as many mistakes in the kitchen as your reviews confirm. They will not get a third chance with me and I will never eat a RR again, no third strikes given.  I WOULD NOT EVER RECOMMEND THIS ESTABLISHMENT TO ANYONE. LET THEM CONTINUE, TO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS, AND WATCH THE BUILDING GO VACANT. THEY GET SO BIG THEY THINK THEY ARE UNTOUCHABLE.  WELL MAYBE THEY SHOULD CHECK WITH ALBERTSONS, OFFICE MAX, OLD NAVY, MANY LARGE  STORES NOT AROUND ANYMORE. NO ONE IS TO BIG TO LOSE THEIR CUSTOMERS AND BE CLOSED FOREVER.
Good lunch spot with a wide variety of menu options.  Bottomless fries are always a plus and the burgers are always tasty.  Red Robin gets my two thumbs up.

This was my 1st time at a red robin chain and I liked it alot!!!   I ordered a patty melt and the mud pie.  The patty melt wasn't cooked as rare as I liked " plenty of pink" but the meat was still tender and juicy.   I don't like steak fries, and should have ordered the sweet potato fries instead. The sweet potato fries are DELICIOUS and definitely worth the extra .89 cents, and since its bottomless you could just order them over and over again to share with everyone.  The mud pie wasn't as big as I thought it would be about 7 inches high, with tons of whip cream everywhere.  It has a chocolate crust with cookies n cream ice cream, and then a huge layer of VERY chocolate ice cream.  The chocolate ice cream is really good, very chocolately I think most chocolate ice cream is never chocolatey enough but this was really strong and perfect flavor.   The plate had alot of fudge and caramel swirls all over it which made it even more delicious.  Our server was Amanda, she was kind of slow,  I think they are understaffed ( which seems to be the case  in most restaurants ) she was so sweet though!!! I really liked her and recommend anyone to ask for her.

Well they don't have grass fed beef, let alone organic BUT they do have yummy gluten free buns! Their  burgers are tasty, the toppings fresh and they HAVE dedicated fryers as well as special allergy stations and dedicated utensils they use for food allergies! This is of utmost importance for true gluten allergies and other food allergies. They will give bottomless broccoli in place fries (they use soybean oil.) we weren't looking for necessarily the healthiest place but a safer place our son could enjoy. We got yummy food prepared perfect and allergy free. No one was put out by our needs which makes for a more delightful experience. We won't eat out if places don't, won't or can't  accommodate. We had wonderful service too. Went their twice in a week and will return.

My hubby and I used to frequent this place @ twice a month.  Life got in the way, so haven't been there for a year.  We went a couple of weeks ago and sat at the bar.  We usually sit at bars at restaurants (except upper scale and when we go with more people) because you get served faster.  The bartender didn't acknowledge us because she was running around being a waitress for tables and tending to the wait staff's customer's orders.  We waited several minutes and decided to go to a different place to eat.   So this past Tuesday, we decided to give it another try.  This time the same busy bartender, stopped what she was doing to let us know she will be with us in a few moments. She did get back to us and asked what we would like to drink.  We told her and then asked her what tables are you waiting? She replied the ones on her left and also the whole bar eating area.  That they decided to do this recently and that she needed to earn a living.  Then instead of making our drinks, she started on the approx. 10 drink ticket orders for the waiters.  Then we told her we are going some place else and left.  I'm not sure, but I thought bartenders made a pretty decent salary?  Otherwise, we did like eating there.  I enjoyed the California Chicken sandwich wrapped in lettuce instead of a bun...Yum.  Am going to miss that.

Family friendly and we love the fries but lately weve noticed you get fewer fries and there always seems to be a long wait for them. I ordered a cup of the clam chowder which is pretty darn good but they served it in what looks like a square saucer and literally there was probably just 1 cups worth. The crispy chicken salad is good but it came on a much smaller plate with a piece of bread that was burnt.  There were a couple pieces of my chicken that made me question if they were cooked long enough. It was a disappointing experience. The restaurant wasnt very busy either. We ate at 4pm. We will try again....eventually.
Red robin rocks. This place had a nice size sitting area and wonderful service.  I had the whiskey burger and my wife ordered the blue cheese burger. We split and both enjoyed them.

We love it here. Great place to bring kids. Good food, fast friendly service. Sabrina was our server today, and she is awesome. She was super busy with bigger tables, but still made sure she took care of us.

I like Red Robin, when it is done right. Tonight, it was horrible.  We decided to try the take out.  BIG MISTAKE!  We ordered 4 burgers. 3 were supposed to be bacon cheeseburgers, with a little pink in the middle. The other was a guacamole bacon cheeseburger, well done. Every one was wrong. The 3 bacon cheeseburgers had no bacon and were well done. The guacamole bacon cheeseburger was almost  rare! Considering we took it to go, we were stuck. Great waste of $45! Will never do that again! The staff however was very friendly.
They have really good burgers and love the endless fries. And my whole family love going here for burgers, (3 kids and 2 adults). Glad its close by our home.

Food was ok but place needed cleaning. Wait staff was super friendly. Just had a hard time getting past the build up of food, dirt, even silver ware on the floor between booth and window. Gross. Front of the house management, this is your job to make sure it's clean!

I sure do love me some red robin, they like all places are nickel and diming customers a little more aggressively than in the past but it's still good cheap food and decent service.  You can take kids there and not worry since it's always loud.

I generally dont like these types of restaurants, but we came here last night and I ordered the teriyaki chicken burger. So good. It has grilled pineapple and swiss cheese. One thing this place has above like, Applebee's and stuff, is the all you can drink root beer floats!
Quick service, friendly staff, good food with a ton of options. Good for large groups that want something tasty without breaking the bank.

Three stars for the sweet waitress, the strawberry lemonade and frozen french fries. Lol. The burger is not good in my point of view. Ive had the Cajun pasta before yuck.  My waitress Gabrielle is so sweet it's almost ridiculous and she is one of the few reason this establishment is worth coming back to!

I love this place. I have officially moved up to a 38 waist line from a 36. The chaffing was really starting to hurt. My favorite is the whiskey river chicken and it never disappoints.  The wait staff is almost always on point except when they are training someone new.  Bottomless fries and a chocolate shake with the burger usually cause me to hibernate for a few hours when I get home.

I used to love this place... But in the recent months it has really gone down hill. Servings are smaller for the same price and the wait staff is slow and inattentive. Anytime I sit in the bar area, even in the booths, the service is worse than ever. Pick up your game, RR.

If you love mouth watering burgers cooked the way you want and you don't mind free refills on your french fries, then this is the place for you.  The service is always excellent and the food quality consistent. If you love spicy food then try the Bonzai Burger, it's my favorite.

Meh..it's okay.  Red Robin used to be better.  Had fish and chips (I know, I know, this is a burger joint).  The fish was just okay, kinda reminded me of something off the Schwanns truck.  The fries were hot on the outside but only slightly warm at the center.  I could give them a pass on the fish since it's a burger joint but not on the fries, they would have been better had they been hot in the center. The service was good.  There are so many better places to eat in the area I probably won't go back.

The food just isn't good enough to warrant the gourmet burger price.  Twice I have had burgers that completely fell apart when barely half eaten. Sauce is used in excess soaking the bun completely.The last time we went my medium-well burger was rare. Soggy burger not grilled to order? I don't think so.  My husband's order of buffalo wings was changed to chicken strips with buffalo sauce without notice or apology. We both decided it wasn't worth coming back.

I don't usually yelp Red Robin because I eat here a lot but today is was rather bad. The service was horrendous. We had Tatum and she is the worst waitress I have ever had at Red Robin. I recommend this Red Robin, but if you get stuck with Tatum asked to be moved to a different section. The management did a great resolving my issue, but I don't think a restaurant manager should get your drinks and take your order.

Sadly went to this Red Robin @ 4:00 PM yesterday with my family. Ordered the Smoke & Pepper burger which was excellent. Unfortunately everyone's fries and my daughters Mac & cheese were cold. My wife asked for and received fresh fries the rest of us are the cold ones. I want this place to do better because when it is good it is excellent. It is just not that way often enough so I am giving up!
Great food and service. Had kids and a baby at the table and server was very patient with the whole family!
Went for lunch on black Friday. For being busy the food and service was still great. Thank you to our server Sara for making it great!

We eat here at least once a month! We usually stick to the amazing burgers and bottomless side of our choice, however they have a great menu other than the burgers! They accommodate any request that you may have regarding personalizing your order. The staff is so friendly and they always recognize us when we come in! We love eating here because it's relaxing, casual and we know our food will always be good! :)
On my first visit, we sat for 30 minutes and never got so much as a glass of water. We left. Manager brought us back for a free dinner.  Not so bad.  They do make a tasty hamburger.

The reason for the low rating is because of the food and service. The food is so not worth the price on the menu and the burgers tend to taste bland and are only cooked well done and the seafood platter was gross!  The clam strips were over cooked and the cod pieces were nasty so that didn't get eaten. The fries have always been really dry, which made me thirsty, and lacked any kind of salt or seasoning. We only go once a year for our daughter's birthday dinner but after this last visit I doubt we'll be back. The service was terrible,  it took about 10 minutes for our waitress to get to our table (there was really no customers and I saw wait staff standing around because the lack of customers), we got our drinks pretty quick, we ordered and didn't see our waitress until after we got our food (she didn't even serve us!!), when she asked if we wanted anything to drink we said yes. I got my soda back and it tasted off, well basically she didn't remember what I had so she just chose a soda for me. Are you fricken kidding me!!! When she gave us the bill she was all nice and was trying to joke around with us (mainly my husband) and when I took the bill looked it over and used my card (he left his wallet) the look on her face was priceless! Anyhow food was terrible, service was terrible and so I left the bare minimum for a tip.  As a former waitress I know that tips are what you relied on but I also know that to get good tips you have to be attentive, be pleasant and give great service.  No matter the occasion,  we will not be returning to this establishment and I don't recommend this place to anyone.

So I wanted to give an update since my review last week.  I received an email from RR thru Yelp, requesting contact info, and then promptly received a phone call from Ben.  He asked to hear my story, and when I finished he was very sincere in his apology, and that he had never in his 8 years in the business heard of such behavior, and wanted to get to the bottom of this right away.  When I  returned home, there was a very nice note from Ben again apologizing for our experience, and thanking me for bringing it to his attention, he also enclosed a gift card good at any RR!   While our experience certainly left a very sour taste, Ben's response, and genuine concern for our experience I think speaks volumes about his organizations desire to make things right, and that the customer is their first concern.  It could have easily  been dismissed by RR, with no action taken at all.  In my review I said that I would never enter this location again, but after Ben's response, I feel they deserve a second chance.  Next time thru Sparks I will stop by and check in.

This place is a great restaurant for the neighborhood. Although it is not as cheap as Awful Awful, nor does one get the same quantity of food, this place is a reasonable place to get a good burger. They offer a full bar and they have drink specials on PBR and other domestic draft beers.  I got the mushroom burger and a malt shake, the food quality was good and it came out in a fast amount of time. All of the ingredients had good taste and it seemed very fresh. The waitress that served our food was friendly and the staff at the restaurant was friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a decent place to eat in the spanish springs area.

I love this place.  It is the best place in town to get good food and good drinks.  Their Mai Thais are to die for.  Be sure to bring a designated driver though because one or two will get you pretty messed up.  The family style environment makes it comfortable and safe to have a good time.

I have eaten at this location many times and have never had a bad experience. Until today. It was very slow. We got seated quickly. My companion ordered iced tea and asked for the sweetener too. When the tea came out, the sugar didn't until she came to take our order and we asked again. I ordered the DGB burger. When it came out it was soaked in the oil the sun dried tomatoes are stored in. The fries were soaked as well. When the waitress came back to check on us I asked her if that was normal. She said she was going to take it to the manager. When the manager came over, she didn't offer any apology.  She asked if I wanted a new one, or because I had taken a bite of it she could bring me a new bun and I could put it on myself. She was short with me and acted annoyed. I asked if I could just have the new bun. She walked away without saying anything to me. She brought back my burger with a new bun on it already. After I got my new fries as well, we barely got checked on. Another man in a normal plaid shirt came back once and asked if I needed lemonade. I have had some great experiences in this restaurant, but not today. For being as slow as it was I am very disappointed.

My first impression upon entering was, "Huh- a red Applebee's." But Applebee's has a more extensive menu- Red Robin says they specialize in gourmet burgers. So in I go. I wanted a bacon cheeseburger but I wanted it blackened. The waitress didn't bat an eye, not a problem. The problem was my "gourmet burger" was a tiny little thing, especially considering the ten dollar price. the patty was so small as soon as it hits the grill it's cooked, so don't kid yourself asking for "medium" or "rare." Ain't gonna happen. There was really nothing special or "gourmet" about it. It definitely did not resemble the picture in the menu, but they never do, do they? There was very little "blackened" taste until the last couple of bites. The meat was fairly tasteless otherwise. Nothing else really stood out, which I thought was unusual for a place claiming to serve "gourmet" burgers. The lad had a BBQ burger, same problem. "Where is the sauce?" Looking closely. "Oh, there it is." The wife had fish tacos which she deemed plentiful and tasty. Plank fries. Hate 'em. They're no better here. Service was good, a little noisy but not bad, but certainly nowhere near "gourmet" burgers. You can get a better burger for a lot less money and a lot faster at Burger King.

First time I have ever been here although I have seen the commercial a thousand times, yummm. Laid back atmosphere. We shared an onion ring stack and I got a Barbeque chicken burger. You get endless fries with your burger which is great unless you just can't stop. Everyone was very courteous. Definitely will be back.

Good place for a step up from fast food burgers when eating out wiith the family. Kids are always happy with the burgers and shakes and bottomless fries.  My husband likes the burgers too....but "gourmet" may be a stretch, and I agree.  This time I ordered the Cobb-chicken salad..it was huge and delicious!  We also had appetizers..wings, pretzel bites and chili queso dip. Wings were okay, nothing stellar. The pretzel bites were delicious..we wish we had ordered more!  However, the chili queso and chips was spicier than we expected and the chips seemed to be stale. Prices are semi reasonable.  All in all not too bad, & I would rate the service as a 5 star if a separate rating was available!

Very Disappointing... To make this short and to the point, we were excited once we heard about the bottomless strawberry lemonades, fries etc..... well we each ordered a dish with a side. when we get out Strawberry lemonade they looked awesome and had strawberries in them,  then our food comes and I get my burger with like 6 fries on them.... of course all the other dishes were the same way, we finish our fries and strawberries and ask for more and they take like 10 mins to bring us more. When they bring them, the lemonade no longer had one strawberry in it and hardly any red of the syrup. For the fries they bring two tiny little baskets with like a total of 8-10 fries each. (For a party of 7) they finished right away everyone got like 3-4 fries each, we ask for a refill and they take like 15 mins to bring us now just one tiny basket for everyone. It's not like they were busy because the girl taking care of us had one more table only. We also asked for ranch and they gave us three tiny cups for all of us. My tip would be they should stop offering bottomless whatever and just serve a good portion for the side that way customers don't need to be asking the waiter and getting upset for a 10 fry refill. Or actually serve a decent amount so no refills are required. Definitely wont be going back to this location. In total we were there for like 2 hours and didn't enjoy one bit of it since it was all just waiting.

It's Red Robin, which is pretty standard. It's better then places like Chili's and Applebees. This is one of the chain restaurants that I don't mind coming to. I do have to say, I like their mud pie quite a bit and the California Chicken Burger is usually my choice for food.

My husband and I go here at least once a month. This is my favorite burger place in town. I am a vegetarian and every time I order the burnin love burger with a vegetarian patty it comes perfectly cooked with all the ingredients evenly distributed. My husband gets their regular gourmet burger "a little pink inside" and they are very consistent. They also have the best steak fries! I don't usually care for thick fries because they are rarely crispy but Red Robin does get them crispy and bottomless to boot! The service has always been good and the food comes out quickly.

Usually I wouldn't give 1 star but my most recent experience here, means I will never return to this or any other Red Robin.  When i simply said "excuse me", to a server, I got the I don't want to be bothered eye roll.  She needs to be fired for sure poor, poor customer service.  This what I got for spending $40.00 on lunch and leaving a nice tip.  Apparently they re not aware the food isn"t that great either.  i had the cod sandwich, which I pulled the fish out of and peeled off the coating to eat the fish and ate the insides of the sandwich, soggy fries, the best part was the tower o onion rings!  No customer service I have no time for you.

My parents ordered take-out here, and was given the wrong order.  The manager gave them a $25 gift card, to make up for it, which they gave to me. I went there yesterday, and the service was horrible.  Our waitress was horrible.  She took our order, then basically forgot about us.  We didn't get our soda's refilled, or even a "How is everything."  Our waitress was too concerned with twirling the receipt holder than to help us.  Also, I am convinced she was on drugs as she didn't look so great and her jaws kept moving and twitching.  This is definitely a turn-off when eating.   Also, we brought a burger to-go for my husband, and specifically told her not to bring it out until we got the check.  Needless to say, the burger was done at the same time as our food, and by the time it was under the warmer for 20 minutes, it was cold.  The manager brought us new fries and it ended up ok.   It ended up being pretty much a free meal, but definitely not worth it!

At the bottom of each Red Robin menu is a statement: "Hamburgers made to order".  On my first visit, I ordered a hamburger MEDIUM RARE.  Instead, what I received was WELL DONE.  I chalked this up as a mistake.  On my second visit, I ordered a hamburger MEDIUM RARE.  The waitress told me that she would 'try' to get the cook to make it the way I wanted.  I received a hamburger WELL DONE.  On my third, and final visit, I again ordered a hamburger MEDIUM RARE and got WELL DONE.  I told the waitress that this was unacceptable.  A few minutes later, the manager came over and explained to me that they could not cook their hamburgers MEDIUM RARE because of state law.  I explained to him that the menu states: "hamburgers cooked to order"  and that my 'order' was a hamburger cooked MEDIUM RARE.  He apologized but would not cook me another hamburger to MY ORDER, but instead gave me a coupon to use on my next visit.  Guess what Red Robin, I'm NEVER going to visit your restaurant ever again!
Red Robin has great burgers and more of a unique menu when it comes to burgers. They also have the best chili cheese fries in the city! Seriously, they are excellent!!!
